alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Perry (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 01 at 1:09PM CST until March 06 at 7:40AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Tennessee... Tennessee River at Perryville For the Tennessee River...including Pickwick Dam, Savannah, Saltillo, Perryville, Johnsonville...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Tennessee River at Perryville. * WHEN...Until Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 366.0 feet, In Perry County, parts of Crooked Creek Road near the river are flooded, along with the camping area at the mouth of Crooked Creek. In Mousetail Landing State Park, campsites in the park and the parking area at Spring Creek Landing are flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM CST Tuesday the stage was 365.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:30 AM CST Tuesday was 365.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 365.8 feet early Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 365.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
